text: Tropical Storm Agatha was a weak but devastating tropical cyclone which brought severe flooding across Central America. It was the deadliest Eastern Pacific storm since Hurricane Pauline in 1997. Agatha was the first storm of the 2010 Eastern Pacific hurricane season. The storm caused 190 deaths and $1.1 billion in damage across Central America. Category:East Pacific tropical storms Category:Deadly storms Category:2010 in weather Category:History of Central America Category:2010 in North America
title: Tropical Storm Agatha (2010)
